is_economic.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the transcript discusses economic conditions, trends, or outlook
Focus on: business conditions, economic activity, GDP, growth prospects, economic indicators, economic forecasts
Include discussions of economic cycles, structural changes, sectoral performance, or economic headwinds/tailwinds
Look for economic assessments even if not using technical terminology
Must be substantive economic content, not just passing references
NO if economics is not a central topic of the discussion

is_policy.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the transcript discusses government or central bank actions, decisions, or deliberations
Focus on: policy decision-making, legislative processes, regulatory frameworks, institutional actions, policy stances
Include discussions of policy approaches, regulatory philosophy, decision criteria, or policy evolution
Look for implicit policy discussions through phrases like 'our approach', 'the framework', 'guidance', 'stance'
Must indicate discussion of policy matters or government/central bank decision-making
NO if discussion is purely about private sector actions without policy context

is_uncertain.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the transcript conveys lack of clarity, ambiguity, or unpredictability about future outcomes
Focus on: unclear outlook, unknown factors, unpredictable elements, ambiguous conditions, indeterminate futures, opaque situations
Include hedging language, expressions of doubt, wide ranges of possibilities, or inability to forecast with confidence
Capture both explicit statements about uncertainty and implicit expressions through tentative language
NO if the outlook is presented with confidence and clarity

is_trade.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Trade Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses international commerce policy, trade relations, or cross-border economic regulations
Focus on: trade policy, trade barriers or openness, international trade agreements, tariff discussions, trade relationships
Include discussions of bilateral trade issues, trade negotiations, customs policies, or trade-related regulations
Must be about trade policy, not just international business operations
NO if only discussing routine international operations without policy context

is_monetary.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Monetary Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses central bank policy, interest rate decisions, or monetary conditions
Focus on: monetary policy stance, interest rate decisions, policy accommodation or tightening, inflation targeting, monetary policy tools
Include discussions of policy paths, monetary policy frameworks, forward guidance, or central bank communications
Look for Fed-specific language like 'policy accommodation', 'normalization', 'balance sheet', even without explicit monetary terms
Must be about monetary policy decisions or central bank actions
NO if only discussing market rates without policy context

is_fiscal.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Fiscal Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses government spending, budget processes, or fiscal sustainability
Focus on: fiscal policy, government expenditures, budget deficits or surpluses, debt levels, fiscal stimulus or austerity
Include discussions of fiscal outlook, spending programs affecting the economy, or long-term fiscal challenges
Must be about fiscal policy decisions, not just government operations
NO if only discussing individual programs without broader fiscal policy context

is_tax.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Tax Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses taxation policy, tax rates, or tax system changes
Focus on: tax reforms, rate changes, tax incentives or burdens, tax code changes, tax policy implications
Include discussions of tax impacts on business decisions or economic behavior
Must specifically address taxation policy or tax implications
NO if only mentioning taxes in passing without policy discussion

is_healthcare.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Healthcare Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses health policy, medical regulations, or healthcare system reforms
Focus on: healthcare policy, health insurance regulations, medical coverage policies, drug pricing policy, healthcare system structure
Include discussions of healthcare costs affecting businesses or economic impact of health policies
Must be about healthcare policy or regulation, not just healthcare industry business trends
NO if only discussing healthcare services or medical topics without policy context

is_national_security.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - National Security Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses military policy, defense decisions, or security threats
Focus on: military conflicts, defense spending, terrorism concerns, security threats, defense policy, homeland security
Include discussions of security risks affecting business environment or economic security concerns
Must discuss security policy or defense matters
NO if only discussing routine international relations without security implications

is_regulation.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Regulatory Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the transcript discusses regulatory policy, oversight activities, or compliance requirements
Focus on: regulatory frameworks, compliance requirements, supervisory actions, regulatory changes, oversight activities
Include discussions of regulatory uncertainty, regulatory burden, or regulatory reform
Capture both increased regulation and deregulation efforts
Must discuss regulatory matters or regulatory actions
NO if only about company self-regulation without policy context
YES if the transcript discusses climate policy, environmental regulations, or energy transition policies
Focus on: climate policy, climate risk, emissions regulations, environmental policy, ESG regulations, climate-related disclosure requirements
Include discussions of transition risks, physical climate risks, or climate-related regulatory requirements
Must discuss climate policy, climate risk, or environmental regulation
NO if only discussing weather, climate science, or sustainability without policy context

is_geopolitical.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index
principles: YES if the transcript discusses international tensions, military conflicts, or cross-border security threats
Focus on: international tensions, military conflicts, geopolitical risk, international crises, war threats, regional instability
Include discussions of geopolitical factors affecting business environment or economic relations
Must discuss international political or military tensions affecting the economy
NO if only discussing normal international business operations without geopolitical context

is_risk.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index; Hassan et al. (2019) QJE - Firm-Level Political Risk
principles: YES if the transcript discusses potential adverse outcomes, threats, or vulnerabilities
Focus on: risk factors, adverse conditions, headwinds, challenges, vulnerabilities, downside scenarios, threat assessments
Include discussions of risk management, risk exposures, or uncertainty about adverse outcomes
Capture both explicit risk terminology and implicit discussions of threatening scenarios
Must explicitly address risk concepts, not just neutral uncertainties
NO if only discussing opportunities or neutral future possibilities

is_event.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index (acts component)
principles: YES if the transcript describes actions that have occurred or are actively occurring, not future possibilities
Focus on: completed actions, current developments, realized events, ongoing occurrences, past decisions that have been implemented
Include discussions using past tense, present perfect tense, or present continuous indicating actual events
Must describe actual occurrences, not forecasts, scenarios, or contingent possibilities
NO if only discussing potential, hypothetical, conditional, or purely future events

is_us_china_tension.citation: Rogers, Sun, Sun (2024) - US-China Tension Index
principles: YES if the transcript discusses bilateral US-China relations, conflicts, or strategic competition
Focus on: US-China trade tensions, technology restrictions, bilateral relationship dynamics, supply chain concerns related to US-China issues
Include discussions of regulatory impacts from US-China tensions or strategic competition effects on business
Must be about bilateral US-China dynamics affecting business or economy
NO if only mentioning US or China separately without bilateral relationship context

is_financial_stress.citation: PÃ¶ttmann (2023) - Financial Stress Indicator from News
principles: YES if the transcript discusses financial system distress, credit market dysfunction, or systemic financial instability
Focus on: credit conditions tightening significantly, liquidity concerns, financial market volatility, counterparty risk, funding pressures
Include discussions of financial stability concerns, credit market stress, or systemic financial risks
Must discuss financial system stress, not just normal market conditions or individual firm issues
NO if only discussing routine market movements or individual financial institution matters without systemic implications

is_energy_uncertainty.citation: Based on World Uncertainty Index (WUI) framework - Energy-specific adaptation
principles: YES if the transcript discusses energy policy uncertainty, energy supply disruptions, or volatile energy markets
Focus on: energy costs, commodity price volatility, energy policy changes, supply disruptions, transition risks, renewable policy uncertainty
Include discussions of energy security concerns, energy market volatility, or carbon regulation uncertainty
Must be about energy policy or market uncertainty affecting business or economy
NO if only discussing energy sector operations without policy or uncertainty context
